docs.lead_paragraph: Heart attack and stroke patients are about to get a new blood thinner that may lower their risk of repeat attacks slightly better than aspirin. But doctors must decide if the drug, clopidogrel, which was approved by the Food and Drug Administration on Monday, provides enough extra benefit to justify paying more than the pennies a day that aspirin costs.

headline.main: U.S. Approves New Version Of Blood Drug

docs.abstract: Food and Drug Administration approves blood thinner clopidogrel, which may lower risk of repeat heart attacks and strokes slightly better than aspirin at far higher cost; makers Sanofi and Bristol-Myers Squibb Co say they will set price when they begin selling drug, under brand name Plavix, early next year (S)
